items.title: Estonia’s tech sector boosts defense startup growth
items.summary:
- Estonia and central/eastern European nations are increasing investments in defense tech following Russia's invasion of Ukraine in 2022.
- Estonia is utilizing its tech industry to support defense startups, capitalizing on its geographical proximity to Russia.
- European defense tech investments grew from 0.4% to 1.7% of total venture capital, amounting to nearly $1 billion between 2022 and 2024.
- Central and eastern Europe have seen a threefold increase in defense funding rounds since the conflict began.
- Estonia's position enables quick collaboration with front-line units and focuses on military tech in private ventures.

items.title: PhonePe begins preparations for IPO
items.summary:
- PhonePe has initiated preparations for its upcoming IPO.
- The company aims to capitalize on the growing fintech market in India.
- Further details regarding the IPO timeline and valuation are yet to be disclosed.

items.title: Temu expands data collection from Korean users
items.summary:
- Temu updates privacy policy for Korean users effective February 21.
- The platform now collects additional personal data such as addresses, phone numbers, transaction amounts, and personal customs clearance codes.
- Users must consent to sharing their data with 27 third-party companies across six countries, including Korea, the US, and Singapore.
- The update follows scrutiny over data collection practices by foreign tech companies in South Korea.
- Last year, investigations were launched into platforms like Temu and AliExpress, with AliExpress fined for privacy violations.
- A decision regarding Temu from Korea's Personal Information Protection Commission is expected soon.

items.title: Brazil fines X $1.4m for failing to share YouTuber’s data
items.summary:
- Brazil's Supreme Court fined X (formerly Twitter) 8.1 million reais (US$1.4 million) for not providing user data on a conservative YouTuber.
- The YouTuber was accused of threatening justices.
- X previously argued it does not collect registration data.
- X was also fined 50,000 reais (US$8,768) per day for failing to block the YouTuber's account and payment transfers.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s biotech startups?
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Southeast Asia’s biotech sector over the past two years.
- It presents a list of firms arranged by the number of deals made in the region, focusing on those that invested in three or more startups.
- The data is continuously updated and aims to provide insights into the impact of each firm in the biotech investment landscape.
- Readers are encouraged to report any inaccuracies in the data by contacting the publisher.

items.title: CATL, Volkswagen partner on EV battery development
items.summary:
- CATL and Volkswagen signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) on Feb. 20 for battery R&D.
- Focuses on new materials, component production, and cost-effective battery products.
- The partnership will also explore battery recycling and swapping initiatives.

items.title: Chinese bubble tea chain Mixue aims for $443m Hong Kong IPO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Mixue Group plans to raise HK$3.45 billion (approximately US$443.66 million) through an IPO in Hong Kong.
- The company will offer 17.1 million shares at HK$202.5 each.
- Bookbuilding for the IPO started on February 21, with trading beginning on March 3.
- Founded in 1997 by Zhang Hongchao, Mixue operates 45,000 stores domestically and in 11 other countries.

items.title: US healthtech AI startup OpenEvidence bags $75m
items.summary:
- OpenEvidence, a Massachusetts-based AI healthcare startup, raised US$75 million in a funding round led by Sequoia Capital, reaching a valuation of US$1 billion.
- This is the startup's first institutional funding since it was founded in 2021.
- The startup has developed a chatbot to assist physicians, currently used by a quarter of US doctors, that is trained exclusively on peer-reviewed medical journals.
- The funds will be used for strategic partnerships and to expand adoption in the healthcare sector.
- OpenEvidence offers its chatbot for free and generates revenue through advertising.
- Founder Daniel Nadler stated the mission is to reduce physician burnout and address healthcare system shortages.

items.title: Billionaire Ryan Cohen raises stake in Alibaba to $1b
items.summary:
- Billionaire investor Ryan Cohen increases his stake in Alibaba to approximately US$1 billion, owning around 7 million shares.
- Cohen first invested in Alibaba in early 2023 and has advocated for share buybacks while discussing a potential long-term partnership.
- Alibaba's US-listed shares surged up to 15% after the news, closing over 8% higher, contributing to a 60% gain this year.

items.title: Ex-Chope CEO joins Susquehanna Asia VC
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Arrif Ziaudeen has joined Susquehanna Asia Venture Capital as part of its investment team.
- He has extensive experience in building and scaling technology ventures.
- Ziaudeen is the founder and former CEO of Chope, a restaurant reservation platform.
- He led Chope's growth for over a decade, establishing partnerships with major firms such as Apple, Ant Financial, Meituan Dianping, and Grab.

items.title: Alibaba Cloud unveils AI model for lifelike animations
items.summary:
- Alibaba Cloud launched Animate Anyone 2, an AI model for character animations from static images and video references.
- Developed by Tongyi Lab, it improves character-environment integration for realistic animations.
- Trained on 100,000 character videos, the model is applicable for entertainment and advertising.
- Experts express concerns about rendering detailed emotions and ethical issues related to deepfakes.
- Despite concerns, professionals find the model useful for generating sample content.

items.title: LG Electronics invests in US-based software firm Apex.AI
items.summary:
- LG Electronics has invested in US startup Apex.AI as part of its series B funding extension, details undisclosed.
- This is LG’s first strategic investment in a US-based mobility software company.
- Apex.AI develops safety-focused software solutions for software-defined vehicles, including the Apex.Grace framework.
- The investment follows an MoU signed last year to develop a next-gen high-performance computer for advanced driving technologies.
- A prototype is expected to launch at CES next year.
- LG’s investment aims to help Apex.AI expand its industry and regional footprint while enhancing vehicle technology solutions.

items.title: Google to open Pixel stores in India to rival Apple
items.summary:
- Google plans to open its first physical retail stores outside the US in India.
- Target locations include New Delhi and Mumbai, with store sizes around 15,000 square feet.
- The stores are expected to open within six months, depending on timelines.
- Currently, Pixel devices are sold through authorized partners in India.
- This move is aimed to compete directly with Apple, which opened official stores in India in 2023.

items.title: Fintech firm Block’s stock falls as Q4 earnings miss
items.summary:
- Block Inc. reported lower-than-expected Q4 earnings, causing a 6% drop in stock during after-hours trading.
- Adjusted earnings per share were US$0.71, missing the projected US$0.87.
- Revenue was US$6.03 billion, below the forecast of US$6.29 billion, but up 4.5% year-over-year.
- Gross profit rose 14% to US$2.31 billion, with gross payment volume exceeding expectations at US$61.95 billion.
- Block forecasts a 15% gross profit increase in 2025, projecting US$10.22 billion.

items.title: Tesla launches virtual queue to ease EV charging delays
items.summary:
- Tesla is launching a virtual queuing pilot for Superchargers in Q2 2025 to reduce wait times and charging conflicts.
- The system will initially roll out at select locations, with a broader launch planned later based on user feedback.
- This initiative follows reports of disputes at Supercharger stations due to limited ports frustrating EV drivers.

items.title: Meta launches community notes on Facebook, Instagram, Threads
items.summary:
- Meta has launched sign-ups for community notes on Facebook, Instagram, and Threads, replacing its third-party fact-checking program.
- The program allows U.S. users to add context to misleading posts with eligibility requiring a six-month-old account, verification, and age 18+.
- Contributors can submit 500-character notes with sources; these will be published if deemed helpful by users with differing views.
- Notes must follow community standards, and the rollout is currently U.S.-only.

items.title: Facial recognition firm Clearview AI’s CEO resigns
items.summary:
- Hoan Ton-That has resigned as CEO of Clearview AI but will remain on the board.
- No specific reason was given for his departure.
- Hal Lambert and Richard Schwartz have been named co-CEOs as the company seeks new opportunities under their leadership.
- Clearview AI, which has a 30 billion photo database, faces criticism and legal challenges over privacy violations.
- Despite claims of growth, Clearview AI is unprofitable, with a valuation of US$130 million following its last funding round in 2021.

items.title: Tesla to enter India with electric cars, plans local factory
items.summary:
- Tesla plans to ship thousands of EVs to India, starting deliveries near Mumbai in the coming months.
- Sales are expected to begin in New Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru by the third quarter of 2025.
- Cars will be sourced from Tesla’s German factory due to India's import duty concerns.
- Negotiations are ongoing with Indian states for a local factory to benefit from EV policy incentives including reduced import duties.

items.title: Truck EV maker Nikola to auction business with $1b debt
items.summary:
- Nikola plans to sell its entire business by April 2025 after filing for chapter 11 bankruptcy with over $1 billion in liabilities.
- At least three potential buyers have shown interest; the bidding deadline is set for March 27 with an auction planned by month’s end.
- If no buyer is found, Nikola will sell assets individually, including its Coolidge, Arizona manufacturing facility.
- The company struggled to secure buyers or investors, with CEO Stephen Girsky revealing failed talks with 22 potential buyers.

items.title: Grab’s Future: AI, Automation, and Maybe No Drivers?
items.author: Anthony Tan
items.summary:
- Grab's shares fell 10% after its 2024 earnings announcement due to revenue forecast for 2025 falling short of analysts' estimates.
- 2024 revenue increased by 19% compared to 2023, and Grab achieved positive adjusted EBITDA for the first time, with net loss narrowing by 67%.
- CEO Anthony Tan announced active discussions with regulators in Southeast Asia regarding the company's plans in AI and autonomous vehicles (AVs).
- Grab's mobility business reported a 20% year-on-year rise in revenue and a 22% increase in adjusted earnings.
- Tan emphasized the long-term opportunities of AV technology and stated Grab's role in the transition to a hybrid AV-human fleet, suggesting that human drivers will not be immediately displaced.

items.title: General Catalyst, Nvidia back AI model platform with $305m
items.summary:
- Together AI, based in San Francisco, raised US$305 million in a funding round led by General Catalyst, doubling its valuation to US$3.3 billion.
- Investors include Prosperity7, Salesforce Ventures, Nvidia, and Coatue.
- The funds will be used to expand cloud infrastructure and deploy Nvidia GPU.
- Founded in 2022, Together AI provides a platform for training and deploying generative AI models, supporting over 200 open-source models.

items.title: UK-based Fluidstack seeks $200m for French AI supercomputer
items.summary:
- UK-based Fluidstack is aiming to raise $200 million to develop an AI supercomputer in France.
- The funding will be used to enhance its cloud computing capabilities with advanced AI infrastructure.
- The initiative highlights the growing competition in the AI infrastructure sector in Europe and beyond.

items.title: US FTC investigates big tech’s moderation policies
items.summary:
- The FTC launches an inquiry into content moderation practices of online platforms including Meta and Uber.
- The examination will assess if moderation amounts to "censorship."
- FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson seeks public comments on moderation's impact on free expression.
- Inquiry follows Republican concerns regarding suppression of conservative viewpoints, highlighted by past bans on figures like Donald Trump.
- Legal protections under Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act may impact the inquiry's outcomes.

items.title: US-based AI cloud firm nets $75m, hits $825m valuation
items.summary:
- San Francisco-based AI startup Baseten raised **$75 million** in its latest funding round, reaching a valuation of **$825 million**.
- The funding round was led by **IVP** and **Spark Capital**, with participation from other investors.
- Founded in **2019**, Baseten deploys AI models using cloud infrastructure from **Amazon** and **Google** for optimized AI execution.
- The company reported a **sixfold revenue increase** over the past fiscal year, serving over **100 enterprises** and smaller companies, including **Descript**, **Patreon**, and **Writer**.
- Baseten supports AI tools like **DeepSeek’s R1 reasoning model**, launched in **January** for cost-effective training.
- The firm has around **60 employees** and competes with companies like **Together AI** and in-house AI teams at major tech firms.

items.title: AI recruiting startup Mercor lands $100m at $2b valuation
items.summary:
- Mercor, a San Francisco-based AI recruiting startup, raised US$100 million in funding, valuing the company at US$2 billion.
- The funding round was led by Felicis, with participation from General Catalyst, DST Global, Benchmark, and Menlo Ventures.
- This valuation is a significant increase from US$250 million in September 2024.
- Founded in 2023, Mercor is profitable with projected revenue of US$7 million and profit of US$1 million expected by February 2025, according to CEO Brendan Foody.

items.title: Israeli fintech FundGuard hires ex-CTO cybersecurity firm
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- FundGuard has appointed Shali Mor as vice president of engineering.
- Mor was previously CTO at CloudGuard, a subsidiary of Check Point.
- He co-founded Protego and held senior roles at Check Point and Cisco.
- FundGuard, founded in 2018, offers a SaaS platform for managing investment portfolios.
- The company has raised US$150 million and has 160 employees based in Tel Aviv.

items.title: US-based fintech startup Varo raises $29m series G
items.summary:
- Varo raised US$29 million in its series G funding round, aiming for US$55 million.
- Total funding since its founding in 2015 exceeds US$1 billion.
- Leadership change occurred with CEO Colin Walsh stepping down, and Gavin Michael taking over in November 2024.
- Varo was the first all-digital US consumer bank to secure a national charter in 2020.
- The company reported a US$65 million loss as of December 2024 despite customer growth.

items.title: Booking Holdings’ Q4 profit rises on strong travel demand
items.summary:
- Booking Holdings reported an adjusted profit of US$41.55 per share for Q4 2024, exceeding expectations.
- Total revenue reached US$5.47 billion, a 14% increase from last year.
- Gross bookings amounted to US$37.2 billion, with a year-on-year growth of 17%.
- Total room nights booked increased by 13%, totaling 261 million.

items.title: US AI coding firm said to raise funds at $2.9b valuation
items.summary:
- A US-based AI coding firm is reportedly raising funds with a valuation of $2.9 billion.
- The funding round is crucial for the firm's growth and expansion in the competitive AI industry.
- The valuation reflects the increasing investments and interest in AI technologies and startups.

items.title: ID music tech startup Demuzo nets $600k pre-seed funding
items.author: Mark Feldman
items.summary:
- Demuzo, an Indonesia-based music tech startup, raised US$600,000 in pre-seed funding.
- The startup launched a music investment platform allowing fans to invest in emerging musicians by purchasing shares of their music royalty rights.
- Funding will support music promotion efforts, including distribution and marketing.
- Demuzo competes with platforms like Corite, Royal.io, and Royalty Exchange.
- Established in 2022 and co-founded by CEO Mark Feldman, who has prior music industry experience.

items.title: Paris-based biotech startup Spore.Bio secures $23m series A
items.summary:
- Spore.Bio raised US$23 million in series A funding to enhance microbiology testing technology.
- Previous funding included €8 million (US$8.39 million) in pre-seed round.
- The startup uses light-based spectral analysis and machine learning for rapid pathogen detection.
- Collaborates with the Pasteur Institute for a bacteria sample database.
- Has contracts signed with 200 factories, causing a waitlist for services.
- Plans to expand workforce from 30 to 50 employees by end of 2025.
- Exploring applications in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals for quicker testing.

items.title: Israeli telemetry startup Sawmills raises $10m seed funding
items.author: Ronit Belson, Amir Jakoby, Erez Rusovsky
items.summary:
- Sawmills raises US$10 million in seed funding led by Team8, with support from Mayfield and Alumni Ventures.
- The startup specializes in AI-powered telemetry data management to optimize costs and improve monitoring.
- Companies spend a median of US$2 million annually on observability, with unexpected costs reported, including a financial firm’s US$65 million charge.
- The funding will enhance Sawmills’ platform to tackle financial and operational challenges in managing observability tools.

items.title: Weekly funding: China-based firms take top 2 spots
items.author: Queena Wadyanti, Charmaine de Lazo
items.summary:
- A list of startup funding activities in Asia is compiled weekly.
- The article notes that China-based firms secured the top two funding spots.
- To access full details on the investment deals, a subscription to the data service is required.
- For more information about funding rounds in Asia, contact bdsg@techinasia.com.

items.title: These funds have not invested in India in the past year
items.summary:
- Funds that have previously invested in India but have not funded any companies in the last year are highlighted.
- Reasons for pausing investments may include waiting for more favorable conditions or a shift in focus.
- The article emphasizes the importance of timing when reaching out to investors.
- For inaccuracies or omissions, readers are encouraged to contact the publisher.

items.title: Indian pet treat brand Dogsee Chew raises $8m series B
items.summary:
- Dogsee Chew has raised US$8 million in a series B funding round led by Ektha.com.
- Total financing for the company now stands at US$22 million.
- Founded in 2015, Dogsee Chew specializes in Himalayan cheese-based pet treats and operates in over 30 countries.
- Funds will be used to expand manufacturing capacity, including a new production facility.
- The company plans to grow its presence in the US and Canada and improve its Amazon Global Selling strategy by 2025.

items.title: EU approves $966.2m German subsidy for Infineon chip plant
items.summary:
- The European Commission approved €920 million ($966.2 million) in state aid for Infineon.
- The funds will be used to build a semiconductor manufacturing facility in Dresden.
- The facility is part of Infineon's Megafab-DD project aimed at producing various semiconductor chips.

items.title: US VC firm raises $6.6m for women’s health startups
items.author: Jessica Kamada
items.summary:
- Swizzle Ventures raises $6.6 million for its first fund, surpassing the original goal of $3 million.
- The fund focuses on women’s health and financial issues such as caregiving and wealth management.
- Founded by Jessica Kamada in 2023, investments will range from $100,000 to $200,000 at pre-seed and seed stages.
- The firm has invested in 11 companies and plans to support a total of 30.

items.title: Palantir shares drop 10% on US defense budget cut fears
items.summary:
- Palantir Technologies Inc. shares fell by 10% on February 19, with further declines in after-hours trading.
- The drop follows a report of a potential 8% reduction in the US defense budget over the next five years.
- Palantir generates over half its revenue from government contracts and reported over 40% growth in its government segment in the past two quarters.

items.title: Once bitten, twice try: Shein’s India return signals a major turn
items.author: Neha Sisodia, Satish Meena, Karan Taurani
items.summary:
- Shein returned to India in January 2023 after being banned in 2020, now through a partnership with Reliance Retail.
- The Shein India app is hosted on local infrastructure and data is stored in compliance with Indian regulations.
- Shein faces competition from major players like Myntra and Zudio, which dominate the online and offline fast-fashion markets, respectively.

items.title: IQiyi launches $300m convertible bond
items.summary:
- Chinese video streaming platform iQiyi launches a US$300 million convertible bond offering.
- The five-year unsecured senior notes have an annual coupon rate between 4.25% and 4.75%, payable quarterly.
- Proceeds will be used to manage existing debt and cover general corporate expenses.
- Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, and JPMorgan are joint bookrunners for the transaction.

items.title: SEA funding round sizes over the past 5 years
Insurtech startup Covu secures $10m investment led by TGV
items.summary:
- True Global Ventures (TGV) announced a US$10 million investment in Covu, a Silicon Valley-based insurtech platform.
- The funding round was led by TGV with participation from Benhamou Global Ventures.
- Covu's technology offers AI-driven tools for automation, risk management insights, and customer engagement, aimed at assisting insurance agents.
- The investment will help Covu enhance its AI capabilities and expand its presence in the US market.

items.title: Alibaba’s financial health in 12 charts
items.summary:
- Jack Ma transformed Alibaba into a major ecommerce player but has been struggling since his departure in 2019.
- Alibaba aims to correct its course amid competition from Pinduoduo and JD.
- The article features interactive charts updated every quarter based on quarterly earnings results.
- Access to complete visuals and metrics requires a subscription.

items.title: Grab’s financial health in 8 charts
items.summary:
- Grab is Southeast Asia’s leading superapp, involved in ride-hailing, food delivery, and financial services.
- The article features interactive charts showing Grab's financial performance, updated quarterly.
- Detailed earnings reports can be accessed from Grab's financial results center.

items.title: Alibaba reports 8% revenue increase for Dec 2024 quarter
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group reported an 8% year-over-year revenue increase, totaling 280.15 billion yuan (US$38.46 billion) for the quarter ending December 31, 2024.
- Net income attributable to shareholders surged 333% year-over-year, reaching 48.95 billion yuan (US$6.7 billion).
- The e-commerce segment, including Taobao and Tmall Group, saw a 9% rise in customer management revenue to 100.79 billion yuan (US$13.8 billion).
- Revenue from Alibaba International Digital Commerce Group rose 32% to 37.75 billion yuan (US$5.2 billion), thanks to cross-border activities in European and Gulf markets.
- Cloud Intelligence Group reported a 13% revenue increase, totaling 31.74 billion yuan (US$4.35 billion), driven by AI product adoption.
- Net cash from operating activities improved by 10% year-over-year to 70.92 billion yuan (US$9.7 billion).

items.title: Oyo plans to open 1,000 serviced hotels in Indonesia in 2025
items.summary:
- Oyo aims to launch 1,000 serviced hotels in Indonesia by 2025.
- This expansion is part of Oyo's strategy to increase its presence in Southeast Asia.
- The initiative is expected to boost tourism and create employment opportunities in the region.

items.title: TikTok said to lay off SG trust and safety team
items.summary:
- TikTok laid off employees from its trust and safety team in Singapore on Feb. 20, 2025.
- At least a dozen employees received termination notices, with some losing access to company systems within an hour.
- Layoffs are part of broader cuts impacting TikTok’s trust and safety teams across Asia-Pacific, Europe, and the United States.
- The decision followed “months of careful consideration” according to an internal email.
- TikTok employs over 40,000 professionals globally in trust and safety.
- The exact number of Singapore employees affected is unclear, as is the extent of layoffs in other departments.
- TikTok has not commented officially on the layoffs, which follow significant workforce reductions in 2024.

items.title: Mandiri Capital Indonesia picks startups for 2025 accelerator
items.summary:
- Mandiri Capital Indonesia (MCI) announces five startups selected for the Zenith Accelerator 2025 program.
- Launched in 2024, the program aims to foster business collaborations with the Mandiri Group’s ecosystem.
- Selected startups include DOOgether, Goers, Mimin, PrimaKu, and Tada, focusing on various sectors from fitness to customer interaction automation.
- The four-month accelerator program will involve mentorship, workshops, and integration with Mandiri Group.
- Partnerships include The Australian Trade and Investment Commission, Amazon Web Services, Karna Law Firm, and the UN Development Programme for additional support.

items.title: Kai-Fu Lee’s 01.AI restructures and spins off key segments
items.summary:
• Kai-Fu Lee’s company 01.AI has announced a restructuring plan.
• Key segments of the business are set to be spun off.
• This move aims to increase efficiency and focus on core technologies.

items.title: VinFast might need to slow down
items.summary:
- VinFast, a leading Vietnamese EV manufacturer, is facing challenges as its main buyer, Green and Smart Mobility (GSM), diversifies and may not sustain growth.
- GSM's rapid growth has led to a high burn rate, purchasing EVs and e-scooters for US$839 million in 2023 alone.
- VinFast aims to double its delivery targets in 2024 with popular models like VF 3 and VF 5, despite potential challenges ahead.
